replies.bodyText:
With all due respect, please see verifiable example with unit test.
https://github.com/fg78nc/camel-type-converter
replies.author: fg78nc

replies.bodyText: You are using the old way (camel 2.x style). In Camel 3.x there is a fast TypeConverterLoader that is recommended to use.
replies.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: Where can I find relevant documentation for Camel 3.x?
replies.author: fg78nc

replies.bodyText: You are looking at it - that doc file has specific sections about 2.x
replies.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: @Converter(loader = true) -  I don't see this "loader" element in @Converter https://www.javadoc.io/doc/org.apache.camel/camel-api/latest/org/apache/camel/Converter.html
replies.author: fg78nc
davsclaus

replies.bodyText:
I fixed the docs. Now with those changes I have working example for Camel 3.x.
I still think documentation is scarce. Would you like to add more details to documentation and probably add working example to Camel examples?
replies.author: fg78nc

replies.bodyText: Yeah an example is welcome with a custom type converter. The old way with loader disabled is still possible, but its slower and uses reflection at invoking the converter at runtime. The loader generates source code so its very fast.
replies.author: davsclaus

replies.bodyText: You can tidy up this PR and we can merge it. Then you can do new PRs for more docs, and another with the example
replies.author: davsclaus
